title: Moss Spores Survive 9 Months in Space, Showing Potential for Future Missions
snippets: A species of moss survived for 9 months on the outside of the International Space Station, new research reveals — and 80% of the samples kept reproducing when returned to Earth.

Their protective casing acts as a natural shield, enabling resilience even scientists didn’t expect. T

title: Arctic Ocean Depths Warming Faster Than Expected, Study Finds
snippets: The depths of the Arctic Ocean have warmed more than scientists expected. New research has placed the blame on warmer water from Greenland

While it is well known that climate change is heating the world's oceans, it was thought that the deep sea was safe from its effects—until now. Researchers have discovered that a rapidly warming part of the Atlantic is leading to the heating up of Arctic Ocean depths.
titles: Climate heating has reached even deepest parts of the Arctic Ocean
Climate change is now warming the deepest parts of the Arctic Ocean
summary: New research shows that the depths of the Arctic Ocean are warming faster than previously thought. Scientists attribute this to warmer water flowing from the Atlantic near Greenland. The findings indicate that deep ocean areas, once considered less affected by climate change, are now experiencing significant temperature increases.
